alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 9:51PM AKST until December 08 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Locally higher amounts north and east of Palmer, including Fishhook and Sutton. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light snow will become heavy, falling at the rate of inch per hour, for several hours tonight. The combination of snowfall rates and the dry nature of the snow resuspended by vehicular travel may significantly reduce visibility along area roadways. The snow is expected to become lighter in intensity early Friday morning before slowly tapering off through Friday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
